reviews.review: Devs showing they are really starting to listen to the community and are actively trying to make positive changes.

鬼ごっこを1vs4で行うイメージのゲームですが、当然1(killer)が速力やギミックを駆使する能力等強いのですが、4(surviver)側がその弱さを補うための『窓枠』『パレット』といったギミックが存在します。これを駆使してsurviverの内一人は時間を稼ぎ、追いかけられていないsurviverがオブジェクトを達成していきます。オブジェクトを規定数達成することでsurviverは生存したままゲームから脱出できます(生存=勝利ではありません)

このゲームにおける"勝利条件"はプレイヤーにより千差万別ですが、マッチング相手が決定する条件であるrankはpipを一定数獲得することで上昇します。よってpip獲得=勝利　として定義します。

これを前提に考えると、killer側は２人の生存者をkill(surviverをdown&hang X 3 X 2 )程度でpipは獲得できます。当然down&hangを4人のsurviverの中で分散することで5人のプレイヤー全員が勝利ということも起こりえます。

また、～7/24の1ゲームでの平均surviverの死亡率が2.2程度だったかと思います。根拠提示できない点については申し訳ありません。公式のアナウンスに含まれていたと思います。
まぁ、この数値が間違っていても2.0を大きく下回る事はないかと。
その上でさっきの勝利条件を見直してみると、killerは半数近くのゲームにおいて勝利出来ていることになります。(camper等、荒れる行為をするkillerは2kill達成しても勝利にはなりませんが、リスク回避を優先しすぎて動かなかった生存者が生き残っても勝利出来ないのと同様です。この両者はゲームバランスを考える上で考慮に入れるべきではないと思います。対策は必要ですが)

そんな～7/24の環境の上で、surviverのスプリント系パーク共通のシステム自体にnerfが実装された上で、killerの複数のperkとabilityに大幅なbuffがかかりました。結果が今の状況です。打開策が見つかってないだけだと思いたいですが、10ゲームほど行いsurviverの死亡率は3.0程度になるかと思います。製作者はこのあたりの数値を目指しているのでしょうかね？

結果surviver激減(同じIDのプレイヤーと出会う頻度が格段に増えました)そして恐らくkillerが増加しており、ゲーム開始までの時間が数分程度～15分程度まで増えています。

(主に生存者の)マナーが悪く不愉快な思いをする（した）人は多くいるかと思いますが、現在の状況は上記のとおり、killer&surviver共にplayer experienceが著しく低下しているというのが私見です。

強くなったkiller側でのみplayするにしても苦戦することが減り、単純に追いかけ一人ずつkillすれば負けはなく、工夫が少なくても勝てますし、ゲームのインターバルが長いのはテンポを低下させ、ゲームへのモチベーションが低下します。

ワンサイドゲームが好きな人は喜んでいるのかもしれませんが、このゲームで最も楽しいのはお互いのperkを徐々に明かしつつ、相手の目論見を看破し、相手の予想を裏切りあい、裏をかかれたリカバリーをし、という読み合いをしながら行う騙し合いです。お互いにゲーム終了後に『hard game』『nice chase』『gg killer』と言わせた時に大きな達成感を得ます。

本当にこのゲームが好きです。だから今の状態では人に勧めることはできません。

最后，我相信，最近这段时间已经有很多玩家退游了，你们真的一点都不在意吗？而且我，真的就我个人，还有跟我一起玩游戏的朋友们，最近一上游戏，两个小时心态就崩了，这个游戏真的已经不适合我玩了，也不适合萌新去玩，我不知道你们将游戏改成这样的用意，也不知道这次是否达到了你们预期的目标，如果是，那么恭喜，这个游戏我也永远不会去碰了，如果与你们预期相反，那是否能重新考虑一下你们做出的游戏改动？

※相当柔らかい表現を使ってますが乱筆・長文です
※キラー専です

-----
ゲーム自体は面白いがプレイヤーと開発が不誠実だと感じます。

・自分にとって不利な調整がきたら低評価爆撃で攻撃するプレイヤー
・低評価を嫌って意図的に片側を優遇する開発

という図式で。

ゲーム内にある問題をゲーム外の盤外戦術でどうにかする、
しょうもないコミュニティが形成されたゲームである　というのが雑感です。

此度のアップデートでキラーが強化されましたが、
前回のフレディナーフ事件同様、低評価爆撃が行われています。
このことに言及させていただくとすれば、
「ゲームを攻略するのではなく開発を攻略すればいい」
というやり方はもう娯楽ではないと思います。

各人に雑感ありましょうが、このゲームに自分が期待していることは
「楽しめるクソゲーであってくれ」程度のことではありますが
ゲーム部分でなく、プレイヤーがクソであることは良クソゲーの必要条件では
無いと思っているので望み薄かもしれません。

プレイヤーの皆さんが「まともな」友人をこのゲームで作ることが出来たなら
それは幸いなことだと思います。お大事になさってください。

少なくとも、今回の調整でキラー側が強化されたことにより、
サバイバー側の一方的なイジメは成立しなくなりました。
もともとのコンセプトであるところの「緊張感のある隠れ鬼」に
立ち返った感もあり、ゲームとしてより面白くなったように感じます。

強化も弱体化もまだ行われていくかと思いますが、普通のプレイヤーからすると
「違う違うそうじゃない」という調整をする開発なので
そんなに騒がずにハナホジしながら構えてりゃ良いと思いますよ。

というわけでゲームだけでなく、コミュニティも含めての低評価と
させていただきました。ご精読ありがとうございました。

With 700 hours poured into the game, I can truly say this is the best balance patch we've got so far. With some buffs and nerfs here and there, we're finally starting to have more variety in terms of builds and killers that are being played. It breaks my heart to see worse players getting discouraged by some specific nerfs and review bombing this page. 

If you are thinking about buying this game and get scared by those negative reviews, let me assure you, those changes were necessary for the game, and it's more fun than it ever was. The problem was it took too long for these changes to come out, and people have a hard time getting adapted. 

Yes, I do recommend buying this game, and please do not let the less skilled players influence your opinion.

Thank you for reading.

After some 700+ hrs of playing this game since last december, I got tired of it. Mainly because I play solo survivor the most and it's the shittiest mode to play lately as now, more than ever, your fellow teammates will proceed to farm you or leave you at the hook long enough so you would die or reach the second stage so their post-game ranking is not threatened as you will definitely have fewer opportunities to do anything after being unhooked. Or they will not do any gens at all, taunt the killer and then trash-talk in post-game chat at them because that's somehow the killer's fault.

On the other hand, the amount of camping has increased drastically in last three months and it's impossible to ignore. I'm mostly playing on rank 5-1 and yet the pattern of the games lately seems like those from rank 20-15. Why would anyone play a game where they get camped three games in a row? It's not fun for anyone involved but it's encouraged by the devs themselves as a strategy... no, I'm not joking.

The main issue in the game is that it's balanced around swf, which even with the latest patch is as strong as ever. A well-coordinated 4-man squad can easily trash the killer because they're using comms. However, the solo survivor suffers because of it, as the killers have grown tired of such treatment, so nearly every high-ranked game now has a mori and a tunneling killer, because they know that if they don't tunnel they will not get three or four kills, as the game is constructed that way. Developers support this with the aura perks, so even if you wanted to play smartly and stealthily, they are still pushing you into a merry-go-round chase around the pallets with the killers. And ever since the latest full patch, they will always hit you when you throw down the pallet but that's about the last thing they'll fix. Gotta fork some more cash from ten more sets of cosmetics first. 

Remove the aura perks, make it feel like an actual horror game by everyone not being able to see through the walls and while you’re at it, remove decisive, it's completely unnecessary.

The developers are so quick in spamming out cosmetics and not caring about serious improvements to the game such as introducing dedicated servers that would solve the issues of constant lobby dodging by both killers and survivors, +500 pings in every 2nd lobby, killers getting butthurt and lag-switching and getting no repercussions for it whatsoever, having to cycle through 10 lobbies because you get weird errors that kick you out of them or the killer thinks you're swf even though you clearly aren't or you have bloody clothes/carry an item so they dodge straight away.

They should also deal with known hackers that freely post content on youtube and call them out all the time. Four of my friends have logged in one day to see their entire savefile wiped clean, but guess what, this is an issue that's still not fixed, so go look up the fix in the guide section, as this happens to players all the time. 

Another thing is the fact that majority of the playerbase is casual, yet with all beforementioned issues they are still forcibly trying to make the game competitive which would require a lot of rebalancing on their part, and I don't think a lot of people would wait around for that, everyone eventually gets tired of a game that panders to individuals rather than the whole community which in itself is incredibly toxic. Kudos to those players that were actually nice, the very few. 

Play something else.

AGGIORNAMENTO: Grazie a mastro ferraio ora può accadere ""di tanto in tanto"" che il terror radius rimanga a 0 per tutta la partita.
Da quando hanno aggiornato il gioco ormai il killer almeno 1/2 kill le fa sempre, non che sia una cosa negativa, ma se pure uno scimpanzè fa 2 kill due domande bisogna farsele. Pallet loop diventati impossibili, e fare il de pip ormai è pressochè impossibile. Yes, i only have a short amount of hours in DBD but after that short period of time, i have encounted the worst and best this game has to offer.

1. TOXIC COMMUNITY. Why can't we have one game, where people aren't people total fucktards because they are "better" then someone else. The amount of times i have come across someone telling me to kill myself and what not because i couldn't excape the killer. 

2. Killing Perks???? I thought the game was meant to be about stealth and being sneaky. I thought i was meant to try and actually repair the gens and only get off them when the killer is near. Well it goes out the door when the killer can just hook someone and see where everyone is hiding.. doesn't that take away the whole point of the game.. I don't have as much of a problem with the one hit down shit, but even that gets old when Adrenline goes off only to get knocked down in one hit anyway.. I may as well be running useless perks the whole time.. :/

3. Gameplay? The whole game can feel real choppy at times.. from the peer to peer connection to just random bugs that happen unexpectedly.. I think ive seen the Killer stuck in a pallet to often to call this a working game.. 

4. Ranks? Now i have 20 or so hours in this game and i made it to rank 13 in that time and was against people who were far far better then me. Im not great at this but im not horrible. But i still feel the ranks are far to easy to get through. And the reset after a month or whatever it is? It reset me from 13 to 15. Why? What difference does that make in the long run? Ill just end up where i was before in maybe 3-4 games.. 

All in all, it is a really fun game. My main suggestion would be to get 3 friends plus yourself and run around agaisnt random killers or even just a whole friends lobby. That is much more fun then the horrors of matchmaking and sitting in the queue waiting for a match only to be put in a lobby with 300+ ping.. 

I really wish i could recommend DBD, but after the small amount of time playing it, there are so many things that make me feel frustrated and annoyed at the end of the day. The little things that they could easily fix. I will continue playing it from time to time, but overall something needs to change.

Don't let my 1,252 hours in this game deceive you, if anything let it speak for my qualms. 

I want to start with the good stuff. The Art Team. The Art Team is phenomenal, the killers are visually appalling and yet oddly attractive, as any horror antagonist should be. The game, while the graphics aren't the greatest, still manages to be eye candy from the details and grim atmosphere alone. Someone please liberate Behaviour's Art Team, their work is amazing and it needs to be put to a better use than this game.

This game is not good. Repetitive gameplay that is extremely unbalanced towards one side. If the four Survivors are even semi-competent bullying the Killer is not an accomplishment, it's a given. Flashlights allow you to completely undo the effects of a chase, toolboxes blaze through Generators even faster (It's 90 seconds for a single Surv to finish a Gen, Great Skill Checks not factored in, so imagine that with 4 Survs all with a Toolbox), and Perk upon Perk allows for second chances that, honestly, you didn't earn. 
Sprint Burst is a Perk that, when you start running, you start running at 1.5x your running speed for a short duration, and it has a cooldown that will regenerate while not running. While fine on paper, this Perk allows for you to instantly get away and start a long chase even if your positioning was bad and/or you failed your stealth attempts. The head start it gives is absurd. 
Adrenaline is a Perk that will heal you one health state and allow you to run at 1.5x speed for a short duration, same deal as Sprint Burst, once the Exit Gates are powered (5 of 7 Generators are completed). It's literally a Win More Perk. It rewards you for already doing well, as an extra shit on the other role's face. 

However, say that the Survivors aren't competent (which is surprisingly common) and/or are not in a Discord call. The Killer will slaughter with little to no competition. This of course will cause the less skilled Survivors to complain that the Killer is too good, despite obviously flaws. So then Behaviour will nerf the Killer. Allowing for the Survivors who are already doing beyond well to dominate even more. 

It's not a fun or balanced system in the slightest.      

For Survivor, the gameplay sums down to holding M1 on a Generator, running in a circle when the Killer finds you. After, you either
A. Escape and go back to holding M1 on a Generator or go save someone who got downed.
B. Get downed and sit on a Hook and wait for someone to stop holding M1 on a Generator and come save you.

For Killer, the gameplay is a bit more interesting but is still only:
1. Spawn into game.
2. Wander around for a bit around generators praying you find a Survivor and they won't be trying to stealth you.
3A. Didn't find a Survivor? Sounds to me like the first 1-2 Generators are now completed, go back to Step 2. 
3B. If you find a Survivor, congratulations! Follow them in a circle until they drop a pallet, in which case you break the pallet and repeat until the Survivor eventually messes up.
4. After all of that running causing anywhere from a 1-5 minute chase (remember how a solo Survivor can finish a generator in 90 seconds?), you've finally downed someone!
